content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents one measure of music in treble clef with four quarter notes. The pitches are C-sharp 4, E4, G4, and B-flat 4.
The figure presents one measure of music in treble clef with four quarter notes. The pitches are C-sharp 4, E4, G-sharp 4, and B4.
The figure presents one measure of music in treble clef with four quarter notes. The pitches are C-sharp 4, E-sharp 4, G-sharp 4, and B4.
The figure presents one measure of music in treble clef with four quarter notes. The pitches are C-sharp 4, E-sharp 4, G-sharp 4, and B-sharp 4.

content.answer: The figure presents one measure of music in treble clef with four quarter notes. The pitches are C-sharp 4, E4, G4, and B-flat 4.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
